text: was a old province of Japan in the area of Hyōgo Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2002). "Settsu" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 846. The ancient capital city of the province was Osaka. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. Maps of Japan and Settsu Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. ==Shrines and Temples== Sumiyoshi taisha was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Settsu."Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 3 . title: Settsu Province
